Even if the game is horrible and addicting, it has given some of the best memories that I could ask for. If you play this game with friends then I highly recommend it, but don't torture yourself with the Hell that is playing solo. Killer is extremely unpredictable with how your experience will go. MMR has ruined the matchmaking unfortunately. Wait until it goes on sale, not worth the price as of right now.
ghostface goes :)

This game is fun, all things considered, if you are willing to learn the ropes in game, rather than actually complete any of the tutorials. 
I have experienced quite a prominent bug in one of the killer tutorials, where Meg, instead of vaulting over the wall, as she is supposed to do, simply runs side by side along the wall. I have tried many different ways to surpass this bug, such as hitting Meg, hitting the wall, downing Meg, progressing over the wall myself. Yet nothing seems to actually work. 
It's a shame, since starting out you really need the blood points - as without a proper tutorial you cannot expect many wins to compensate the over 200k loss through being unable to progress through them. 

Has anybody found ways to combat this bug? I've tried soft and hard resets, as well as scouring online for a fix?

Probably the most horribly unbalanced game I've ever played, but can still be very fun, especially if you play with a friend.

A hollow "meh" from me. Tried to get into it with friends but was daunted that the cost of the game wasn't the full price of admission. I hate feeling fleeced for cash. Seems this game likes to tip power scaling the new release killers towards the broken side of the metric. I doubt their sincerity with their so called "mistakes" of balancing and I feel like it's more of a desperate attempt to drive up sales in the early release window.

It's an ONLINE game. What are you expecting, the sweetest players all time? The game has some issues like hackers from time to time or some unusual bug that then gets fixed.

The game is not bad and has a lot of nice events, great variety of characters and abilities for each side (survivors and killers), alongside a big list of different maps with different variations of each.

YES. You have the campers or tunneler killers, or the shittiest teammates you will find and sometimes if that happens 2 or 3 consecutives matches it can be a little frustrating. And if you get people shitting on you on the end chat:
That's not the game being bad, it's the people. Just block and move on like why waste time on someone you don't even know and treats this game like life depends on it?

Again, it's an online game. Think of all the online games that have VOICE CHAT.
